Package kpa.reasoning

Package holding all classes for automatic reasoning.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CompoundReasoner
    Applies multiple reasoners in sequence.
    EmptyCellReasoner
    Abstract template class for reasoners based on empty cells, using the Template Method design pattern.
    EntryWithOneEmptyCell
    When all cells but one of an entry have been filled, then the last empty cell remaining can be calculated.
    FixpointReasoner
    A reasoner that repeatedly applies a given reasoner until the least fixed point is reached (a closure operation).
    Reasoner
    Base class for reasoning strategies (reasoners).
    ReasonerDecorator
    Abstract base class for reasoner decorators, holding common code.

Package kpa.reasoning Description

Package holding all classes for automatic reasoning. See the contract of Reasoner.apply() for details on how a reasoner works. A reasoner is used by
  • constructing a new reasoner, and providing the puzzle it operates on, plus possibly another reasoner (in case of decorated reasoners);
  • optionally combining it into other reasoners, using FixpointReasoner, and/or CompoundReasoner (via add());
  • calling its Reasoner.apply() method;
  • handling the returned result:
    • If null was returned, the reasoning led to a contradiction, indicating that the puzzle is not solvable from this state; the puzzle has not been modified
    • If the returned CompoundCommand is empty, then reasoning did not result in any forced commands; the puzzle has not been modified
    • If the returned CompoundCommand is non-empty, then reasoning led to the returned forced commands; these commands have been executed on the puzzle.

New reasoners can be defined in various ways:

  • By inheriting from Reasoner and overriding Reasoner.apply()
  • By inheriting from EmptyCellReasoner and overriding its hook method applyToCell() (Template Method pattern); EntryWithOneEmptyCell is an example
  • By inheriting from ReasonerDecorator and overriding Reasoner.apply() using the decorated reasoner (Decorator pattern); FixpointReasoner is an example
